results.title: Monsieur Rene Magritte
results.creator_credit: Neil Mundy, Adrian Maben, WDR, Antenne-2 and RM Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Phaidon art collection”.
About the life of Belgium artist Rene Magritte, one of the most famous of all surrealists. The documentary discusses his personal life and the motivations behind his art. Obsessed with the everyday, Magritte’s practise was to reinvent the ordinary by changing the ‘viewers’ perception. “It’s not the painting that changes your perception, it’s the thoughts triggered when looking at the work that does”. As a metaphysical painter like his mentor De Chirico, Magritte sought to make reality and meaning represented as visionary not literal - it’s this legacy that is explored in this documentary.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Neil Mundy, Adrian Maben, WDR, Antenne-2 and RM Productions

results.title: Monsieur Pointu
results.creator_credit: Rene Jodoin, ONF | NFB, Bernard Longpre and Andre Leduc
results.brief_description: Here is screen magic at its best. Virtuoso stage entertainer Monsieur Pointu (his real name is Paul Cormier, renowned beyond his native Quebec), becomes even more animated through the art of film animation. He and his violin are literally taken apart - head, feet, limbs, various items of stage attire, bow, strings, and box go into their own separate acts, with strange and amusing results. Film without words. (Four awards, including Oscar nomination, Hollywood)

results.title: Monsieur Bais
results.brief_description:
Charles Bais is a well-to-do architect married to Marthe, a harpsicord player. The day following Charles’ purchase of a handgun, Marthe is found dead in bed with a bullet wound to the heart. The murder investigation conducted by Judge Massot reveals that Charles used to enjoy a rather ecclectic sex life and that he was in the habit of sharing his mistresses with his good friend Docteur Noel. Judge Massot’s attention becomes increasingly drawn to one of Charles’ conquest: the mysterious Camille.

Credits: Producer, Jean Gauthier ; director, Claude Barma ; writer, Pierre Dumayet ; photography, Ghislain Cloquet ; music, W. A. Mozart.
Cast: Simone Signoret, Michel Vitold, Didier Haudepin, Anna Karina, Maurice Ronet, Georges Wilson, Gisele Grimm.

results.title: Monkeys, apes and man: exploring the chasm
results.creator_credit: National Geographic Society, Wolper Productions and Jeff Myrow
results.brief_description: Explains how studies of primate social organisation, use and manufacture of tools, ability to learn, and socialisation, have shown that the similarity between monkeys and humans is not superficial.

results.title: Monkeys
results.creator_credit: Bill Walker, Coronet Films and Mel Waskin
results.brief_description: Shows different species of monkeys and their characteristics, noting that while most monkeys live in hot climates, there are some that prefer snow. Also shows the lemur, a tree-dwelling primate which although similar to the monkey is not of the same species. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Monkey: eps. 7-9
results.creator_credit: Nihon Terebi, Kokusai Hoei and Yasutaka Tanaka
results.brief_description: The Beginning of Wisdom: Desperate for water, the pilgrims stumble into a drought stricken vilalge. The local drought demon, who has a taste for little boys, has cursed the village with drought because the villagers have no more boys left to sacrifice. “Pigsy Woos a Widow”: Pigsy falls in love with a pretty widow after Monkey saves her from the Demon Spirit of Great Snakes. The widow however, only has eyes for Tripitaka. “What Monkey Calls the Dog-Woman”: When magistrate Lord Li’s stepdaughter is taken by bandits, Monkey reluctantly takes on the job of rescuing her. Based on the sixteenth century book of the same name by Ch eng-en Wu. Dubbed in English.

results.title: Monkey: eps. 4-6
results.creator_credit: Nihon Terebi, Kokusai Hoei, Tsuneo Hayakawa, Muneo Yamada, Tadahiro Nagatomi, Yoji Katori, Kazuo Morikawa, Ken Mumagaya and Yusuke Watanabe
results.brief_description: Monkey swallows the universe - Tripitaka and Sandy get into a fix. Pigsy is bewitched by a beautiful woman and Monkey finds himself in trouble again as they enter the land ruled by the demonic Golden Horn and his wife, Silver Horn. “The Power of youth” - Tripitaka is kidnapped by the King of Youth to attract the attention of Heaven and Earth. With Sandy and Pigsy busy, it is left to Monkey to save his friend. “Even monsters can be people” - after killing a girl and her parents, Monkey is sent away by Tripitaka despite swearing they were really demons in disguise. The pilgrims realise that Monkey was telling the truth, but his failure to believe Monkey leaves Tripitaka in danger. All episodes are dubbed in English.

results.title: Monkey: eps. 1-3
results.creator_credit: Nihon Terebi, Kokusai Hoei and Daisuke Yamazaki
results.brief_description: Monkey Goes Wild About Heaven: Mischievous Monkey is summoned to Heaven where he steals the heavenly peaches and fights with two of the Emperor’s officials, after which all three are expelled to Earth. Monkey is imprisoned under a mountain, while the other two are transformed into a pig monster and a water monster. “Monkey Turns Nursemaid”: Buddha sends Boddhisattva Huan-yin the Compassionate as messenger to find a holy man to journey from China to India to fetch the large vehicle scriptures. She chooses the boy priest Hsuan Tsang, and bestows upon him the name Tripitaka. “The Great Journey Begins”: Tripitaka and Monkey begin their perilous journey. Along the way they encounter Pigsy and Sandy. Based on the sixteenth century book of the same name by Ch eng-en Wu. Dubbed in English.

results.title: Monkey trouble
results.creator_credit: Mimi Polk, New Line Cinema and Franco Amurri
results.brief_description: Dodger, a monkey, belongs to a crooked street performer but escapes, his life to end up in the arms of an innocent little girl. Her mother has no idea that her daughter is harboring a fugitive. Unfortunately, Dodger’s naughty habits get the best of him as his mischief plunges everyone he meets into major monkey trouble. Cast includes Thora Birch, Mimi Rogers, Victor Argo, Christopher McDonald, Harvey Keitel.

results.title: Monkey on the back
results.creator_credit: Grant McLean, ONF | NFB and Julian Biggs
results.brief_description: This documentary drama, based on the real-life experiences of a drug addict, not only portrays the terrible consequences of the misuse of narcotics but presents the general problem of addiction and, particularly, of the addict as an individual. Dick Smith lost everything valued most in life because of his craving for the narcotics which finally killed him. In relating the story of his attempts to break the habit, the film reveals the essential nature of addiction as both a social and a human problem.
